intro: Hutchinsia californica, commonly known as the California hutchinsia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to Mediterranean climates. It features slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in spring. The leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine.
